pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau meets with California Lieutenant Governor Gavin Newsom | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Today, the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, met with the Lieutenant Governor of California, Gavin Newsom, during the Prime Minister’s visit to San Francisco.

The Prime Minister and the Lieutenant Governor discussed a range of Canada-California issues, including the significance of the North American Free Trade Agreement to both economies and shared efforts to address climate change.

Canada-California bilateral trade was valued at US$25.4 billion (2016) with over 1.2 million jobs in California dependent on trade and investment with Canada. Canada is California’s second largest export destination.
